# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 278, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 764, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 559, 484, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 574, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 665, 216, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 681, 388, 696]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 803, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(6x^{4} + x^{3} - x^{2} + 5x - 6\) is divided by \(2x^{2} - x + 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 85, 739, 262]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 282, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y^{2} = A\mathrm{e}^{kx}\), where \(A\) and \(k\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (1.5, 1.2) and (5.24, 2.7) as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 554, 364]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(A\) and \(k\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 345, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 306, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 92, 554, 127]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{1}^{4}x^{\frac{3}{2}}\ln x \mathrm{d}x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 418, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \cos x \sin 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the stationary point in the interval \(0 < x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Express \(\sqrt{2} \cos x - \sqrt{5} \sin x\) in the form \(R \cos (x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\). Give the exact value of \(R\) and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = \sqrt{3} x^2\), find by integration the exact area of the shaded region bounded by the curve, the \(x\)-axis and the line \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 100, 584, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{y - 1}{(x + 1)(x + 3)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 140, 381, 159]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 2\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 171, 712, 190]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 171, 920, 190]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \((1 + 2\mathrm{i})w + \mathrm{i}w^{*} = 3 + 5\mathrm{i}\). Give your answer in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
(i) On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z - 2 - 2\mathrm{i}| \leqslant 1\) and \(\arg (z - 4\mathrm{i}) \geqslant -\frac{1}{4}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 540, 195, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 540, 910, 560]]<|/det|>
Find the least value of \(\operatorname{Im} z\) for points in this region, giving your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 555, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 148, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(p_{n + 1} = \tan^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{1 + p_n}\right)\) to determine the value of \(p\) correct to 3 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 608, 185, 625]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 606, 584, 625]]<|/det|>
Hence find the value of \(k\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 606, 920, 625]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors given by \(\overrightarrow{OA} = 6\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} = 2\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k}\). The midpoint of \(OA\) is \(M\). The point \(N\) lying on \(AB\), between \(A\) and \(B\), is such that \(AN = 2NB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 139, 146, 158]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 139, 579, 158]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line through \(M\) and \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 139, 920, 158]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 730, 92]]<|/det|>
The line through \(M\) and \(N\) intersects the line through \(O\) and \(B\) at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 148, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 393, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 589, 528]]<|/det|>
Calculate angle \(OPM\), giving your answer in degrees.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 73, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
